author: sky.cactus
content: It isn't too hard with a bot.  You can know precisely what the base fee will be in the next block, and those bots usually compete on priority fee or equivalent, so a large portion goes to proposer (sometimes as much as 99%).

author: ajsutton
content: But blocks are almost never 100% full so couldn't you always get your tx into the next block and so know what the base fee will be? I mean there's a little bit of timing but seems like something wallets could manage for you pretty accurately.

author: sky.cactus
content:
Not possible with current user facing tools which are designed to set base fee high to ensure quick and reliable inclusion.  You can build bots that do this, but that is beyond most users.

Wallets could have a sweep option that submits a new transaction every block, but you need keys live in memory for that (not transiently decoded or only on a TPM that requires user input to access).  Also virtually impossible to do this with a hardware wallet.  You also would have to bump the gas price each block to deal with replacements I think.
